content.description:
Start on the low right overhanging arête of the boulder. Do a few moves into a left facing left hand and a right facing right hand and from there do a big move to the top corner good sloper of the boulder and do a tricky push out mantle.

 If I am missing any information, please let me know!

Start right hand on the squared comfy crimp in the roof and with your left hand in the last of the jugs. Make a few powerful moves rightwards under the lip to top out on the sloper on the corner of the boulder.  The crux of this problem appear to be slightly height dependent, as the difficulty is based less on how bad the holds are and more on how hard the movement its. Regardless of the grade, this is a super fun problem, so give it a go!If I am missing any information, please let me know!
content.protection: Multiple crash pads, a spotter would also be helpful!

content.description: A steep problem with relatively good holds and hard movement.  Start sitting on an obvious jug on the far bottom and left side of the boulder. Go to a large edge under the lip and make a powerful move to a crimp.  Getting past the first crimp can be done with a number of different betas. A few more moves through good holds below the lip into the start of Mordor Stand.  Power through the crux and finish up the problem!  The crux sections of this problem appears to be slightly height dependent, as the difficulty is based less on how bad the holds are and more on how hard the movement its. Regardless of the grade, this problem is super fun, so give it a try! The moss on the lip should not be removed it is a sign for it not to be used. The entire climb relies on holds below the lip (until the topout).  If I am missing any information, please let me know!
content.protection: Multiple crash pads, a spotter would also be helpful!

pathTokens: Rocky Gorge Reservoir  (T. Howard Duckett Reservoir)

content.description: Arguably the best roof Rocky Gorge has to offer. The landing for the climber is good, but if you're spotting, watch your step! The landing area drops off quickly a few feet out past the boulder. The mossy lip on the left side of the boulder should not be used for any of the climbs.
